turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about SS City of Glasgow.
turn.2: On 5 October 1850, she was purchased by the newly formed Liverpool and Philadelphia Steam Ship Company (also known as the Inman Line) and moved to the Liverpool – Philadelphia route from 17 December 1850.
turn.3: What did you find most interesting about the article?
turn.4: In 1852, the company entered the immigrant trade and "City of Glasgow" was refitted to accommodate an additional 400 third class passengers in her holds.
turn.6: Cabins were available in state rooms from fifteen to twenty one guineas for each berth.
turn.7: What else can you tell me about the passengers?
turn.8: Steerage passengers were charged eight guineas.
turn.9: Were they allowed to bring anything else?
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: "City of Glasgow" left Liverpool on 1 March 1854, with 480 people on board.
